text:p.text:span: OASIS Unstructured Operation Markup Language (UOML-X) TC

office:text.text:p: Case 2: Full text search - extract text data from docbase in order to generate a text file called “output.txt”.
Case 3: Image OCR operation- Transform image formatted data to a text formatted data.
Case 4: Converts different type of documents to UOML documents.
Case 5: Send documents to fax or cell phone via UOML.
Case 6: Write and make comments to UOML documents.

text:p.text:span: Detailed usage for all the UOML Instructions.
Example of UOML API in C.

office:text.text:p: Follow is a scenario on how two people using different word processors to exchange document:

text:p.text:span: Someone generates a document using UOML compliant word processor “A”, and save it as an UOML document. He sends it to another person to read.

office:text.text:p: The second person receives and opens the document using any available UOML compliant word processors, it is not necessary to use the same software as the first person. He chooses to use word processor “B”.

text:p.text:span: Read ,add and make comments to the document:

office:text.text:p: UOML standard document resembles a paper document with many digital and intelligent features. So the second person can read, add and make comments to the document on screen just like what we do to a piece of paper using word processor “B”.

text:p.text:span: Save the change and send the document back to the first person.
Receive, read, add and make comments again:

office:text.text:p: The first person receives the reviewed document, and then he can read it with word processor “A”, if needed he can add and make comments to it again.

text:h.text:span: Full text search – extract text data from docbase and generate a text file “output.txt”

text:p.text:span: Create an empty document called output.txt as the output file.
Set the objectSet as the current object.
Initialize an incremental variable index to 0.
Operate an UOML_GET operation to current objectSet as follow to get
the handle of the current index indicated object:

office:text.text:p: If UOML_GET failure, go to step 5, the operation end.
If UOML_GET success, do the follow operation to get this object’s XML expression:
If UOML_GET to get XML expression returning value is not UOMLO_TEXT
If UOML_GET to get XML expression returning value is UOMLO_TEXT
Get the text data, export to output.txt.

text:p.text:span: End, save the output.txt, close docbase,

text:h.text:span: Image OCR operation – Transform image formatted data to a text formatted data

text:p.text:span: Open docbase, get the objectSet handle.
Set the objectSet as the current object.
Do the follow operation to the current object
Operate an UOML_GET operation to current objectSet as follow to get

office:text.text:p: If UOML_GET failure, go to step 4, end the operation
If UOML_GET success, do follow operation to get this object’s XML expression:
If UOML_GET to get XML expression returning value is not UOMLO_IMAGE
If UOML_GET to get XML expression returning value is UOMLO_IMAGE
Get document’s image data; call a third-party OCR engine to convert image data to text data.
Operate the UOML_DELETE to delete the image data.

text:p.text:span: Put the image converted text data to an UOMLO_TEXT format’s XML structure, using UOML_INSERT to put it to the image data’s original position

text:h.text:span: Convert different type of documents to UOML documents

text:p.text:span: Please install UOML Writer first if the computer you are using now doesn’t have it. UOML Writer is a virtual printer, can be downloading freely from
Run any third party word processor A. Assume word processor A supports type A document.
Using word processor A to open type A document - file.A.
Go to word processor A’s Print function, from the printer list, choose UOML Writer.
A window appears. Write down the converted UOML document name, and the path.
Save it. Now file.A has been converted to an UOML document. End.

text:h.text:span: documents to fax or cell phone via UOML.

text:p.text:span: Get a printable document, it can be any file type; please first convert it to an UOML document via UOML Writer (check case 4 for details).
Transform the UOML document to a .bmp file.
Loop through the docbase, do a serial of UOML_GET instructions to get the handle of the document we need:
Do UOML_GET to get the handle of each page from the document.
Do UOML_GET to generate a new .bmp file for this page, and get its handle..
Send the .bmp file to a third party fax server or a cell phone.
User reads the document from fax paper or from a cell phone screen.

text:h.text:span: Write and make comments to UOML documents

text:p.text:span: Loop through the docbase, do a serial of UOML_GET operations to get the handles of all the documents we need:
Get the handle for the page which user had made comments and added things on.
Create a new layer to this page, and insert a new object set to this layer, get the handle of this layer:
Do the UOML_GET to get the handle of the newly created object set.
Get the added information from the script board, convert it to UOMLO_PATH object.
Insert UOMLO_PATH to the new object set. Here for demonstrate purpose, the path only includes one rectangle. In real case, it might include very complicated path to represent the

office:text.text:p: Follow is the total nine current UOML Instructions:

text:p.text:span: For details about each UOML Instruction’s properties, please check UOML Specification (current UOML Working Draft 01) Section 3

office:text.text:p: //set an object as the current object.
//Get the bitmap expression of one page.
//Get the property value of an object.
//Get the sub_object handle based on index value.
//Get the XML expression of the object.
//Base on provided XML value to reset the object and all its sub_objects.
//Insert an object under another one as its sub-object.
Following are some examples to implement UOML API through C.

text:p.text:span: the interface to send a request to UOML.
the interface to parse the return value from UOML

office:text.text:p: String strRet = uoml_call(“<uoml:UOML_OPEN path=\”/home/admin/storage/1.sep\” create=”true” del_exist=”false”/>”)
office:text.text:h: Send an UOML_SYSTEM Call – save the docbase
Send an UOML_USE call – set the current object
office:text.text:p: //Get the bitmap expression of one page.
//Get one of the property value of an object.
//Get a sub_object handle based on position value.
//Get the XML expression of an object.
//Set up a property value for an object.
//Reset the content of an object based on the given XML expression.
//Get the returning value after using UOML instructions.
//Check the UOML instruction operation is success or not.
//Get the error code after using UOML instruction.
